title: Poster, Kenny Scharf / Tony Shafrazi Gallery, 1984
medium: Offset lithograph on heavy white wove paper
inscribed: Imprinted in gray across upper section on white: KENNY SCHARF. In gray across bottom: TONY SHAFRAZI GALLERY 163 MERCER STREET NEW YORK/FUN GALLERY 254 EAST 10thSTREET NEW YORK FEBRUARY 25 - MARCH 24 1984. Imprinted in gray at lower right along right edge: photo: Ivan Dalla-Tana
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Central image is what appears to be a dance between two metalic pin shaped cartoon creatures, green on the left and orange on the right. They dance on stylized flowers and vines against a striated air-brushed background of pink and blue bands. A lage yellow cell with nerve-endings floats above.  At top a band of black with asteroids suggests the universe.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Kenny Scharf / Tony Shafrazi Gallery, 1984. Offset lithograph on heavy white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-200
